channel.title: How to make the acoustic guitars have a beautiful clean strum
channel.description: When I first used acoustic guitars in auxy I was like how can I make the guitar sound like a clean strum. well for a year I toiled around with the guitars and finally I figured it out! The guitars to begin with already have a bit of a strum to them naturally but if you pitch them down a whole octave it slows the strum effect significantly which makes it sound amazingly clean. Another little tip for arp guitars chords is to add an 3/16 delay which makes sound a ton fuller.

item.title: How to make the acoustic guitars have a beautiful clean strum
item.dc:creator: Jax
item.description:
Yes, that’s what I was trying to say, but you did a much better job of saying it

Read full topic

item.title: How to make the acoustic guitars have a beautiful clean strum
item.dc:creator: GioMakyo
item.description:
You can do this at slower tempo too. The best way is to use 1/32 notes, and put one or two notes in one step early, and one or two notes one step late, with the bulk of the notes right on the one beat. Generally it’s best to go low to high, so if you have a 6 note chord, put the lowest note 1/32 early, and The highest note or two 1/32 late. Imuse this all the time, so if anyone wants me to post an example, I’d be happy to.

Read full topic
item.source: How to make the acoustic guitars have a beautiful clean strum

item.title: How to make the acoustic guitars have a beautiful clean strum
item.dc:creator: Jax
item.description:
Cool! I didn’t know this, thanks for sharing!

Another way to do it is to set your notes to 1/32 and set the tempo to 180 or above. For a chord, put the last note on the beat, and for each note after, set it one step back. I can make a demo project explaining if you would like.

Read full topic
item.source: How to make the acoustic guitars have a beautiful clean strum

item.title: How to make the acoustic guitars have a beautiful clean strum
item.dc:creator: JacobJustus
item.description:
When I first used acoustic guitars in auxy I was like how can I make the guitar sound like a clean strum. well for a year I toiled around with the guitars and finally I figured it out! The guitars to begin with already have a bit of a strum to them naturally but if you pitch them down a whole octave it slows the strum effect significantly which makes it sound amazingly clean. Another little tip for arp guitars chords is to add an 3/16 delay which makes sound a ton fuller.
